text: Hello, how much do i have to pay to have access to the API?

*Hi,*

I’m trying to build a report in HubSpot to track how many web bookings were preceded by a call to the call center. The goal is to identify contacts who:
1. Had a recorded call in HubSpot *before* they booked online.
2. Have a *confirmed booking* (moved to “Confirmed” stage).
3. The *call timestamp* should be *before* the “Most Recent Confirmed Booking Date.”
I’ve applied some filters, but I’m not sure how to correctly set up the time-based condition between the last call and the booking date. Right now, my report only filters calls within the last 14 days, which is incorrect.
Could you guide me on the best way to structure this? Is there a way to compare *"Last Aircall Call Timestamp"* with *"Most Recent Confirmed Booking Date"* within the report builder?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Hello everyone, is there a way to activate Content Hub Professional on developer portals / sandboxes? I am currently interested in the embed feature, but unfortunately I can’t develop / prepare / try anything in that area.

If you create a developer account, you can then create a test account (your own test portal) and that test account will be enterprise level so you can test anything you want there.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started>

Take a look at your Account & Billing in that test account (see mine below).  I am wondering if what you're trying to access that you don't see is a beta you need to join.  Take a look at product updates and see.
No Embeds is not a beta feature, its just not included in the test account license

Yeah, when it was all under Marketing Enterprise it would have been included.  But it seems when they ported marketing stuff over to the new Content Hub, that is not included in test accounts - I did not realize that and I personally think they need to fix that for test accounts that are supposed to contain all enterprise features so developers can test properly - that really sucks
FYI: I am checking around with some HS folks to see if this can be fixed - never know

API has a free tier. This page has more of a breakdown:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/apisbytier>

Hello,

I'm working with a client who uses non-HubSpot forms. We ran into an issue where the forms merged contacts, presumably ones generated from the same browser session.

For example, they have sales reps who may help customers sign in or set up an account. They also have people working in the same office who are being merged into one contact.

Does anybody have experience with this? We want it to work the same way as the HubSpot native forms, where we can create a new contact every time a new email address is used.

Thanks in advance!

Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face:
I found a BUG and I need a solution.
It's related to new *BLOG* and *BUSINESS UNITS*.
So, if a blog is created in a Business Unit, a default Comment form is also created, but *NOT* in the same Business Unit. So if you have 5 Business Units, and each will have a blog, all the comments forms will be created in the *default Business Unit*.
Have anyone had this issues before ? How you solved it ?
Thank you for your suggestion! I'm just not sure why this isn't just built into HS? If I'm able to style the font size in the rich text editor, i should be able to display it too, no?
